data.name: Run n times
data.description:
Write a wrapper function `nTimes`. 

The first argument to `nTimes` is another function. Part of our wrapper function's job is to execute this other "interior" function, taking in arguments for the interior function as necessary and returning the interior function's return value. 

The second, optional argument to `nTimes` is the number of times our wrapper is to be able to run its interior function. The other part of one of our wrapper function instances' job is to check if the instance has been run more than n times. If so, the interior function should not be run again. This second argument should default to 1.

How this might play out:
```
var interiorFunction = () => true;
var wrapper = nTimes(interiorFunction, 5);

wrapper();  // returns true
wrapper();  // returns true
wrapper();  // returns true
wrapper();  // returns true
wrapper();  // returns true
wrapper();  // returns undefined
wrapper();  // returns undefined
```
After being called 5 times, the result of `wrapper` is no longer defined.
